reference.title: Modular-Modbus

entry.ph: NMC model number
The model number of the NMC.
NMC serial number
The serial number of the NMC.
NMC firmware revision APP
The firmware revision of the Reality application for the NMC.
NMC firmware revision
The firmware revision of the NMC.
NMC date of manufacture
The manufacturing date for the NMC.
NMC/UPS time (hh:mm:ss format)
The NMC/system time (hh:mm:ss format).
NMC/UPS date (mm/dd/yyyy format)
The NMC/system date (mm/dd/yyyy format).
Reality name
The name for the system entered in the NMC.
Probe 1 temperature
The measured temperature from the optionally connected temperature and humidity sensor (AP9335TH) or the temperature sensor (AP9335T). Only available if the sensor is connected.
Probe 1 humidity
The measured humidity from the optionally connected temperature and humidity sensor (AP9335TH). Only available if the sensor is connected.
UPS model
The model of the connected UPS or system.
UPS type
The type of the connected UPS or system.
UPS serial number
The serial number of the connected UPS or system.
UPS manufacturing date
The manufacturing date of the connected UPS or system.
MCU Modbus revision
The Modbus revision of the UPS or system controller.
MCU part number
The part number of the UPS or system controller.
Software version of MCU (Index)
Software version of the UPS or system controller (Index).
MCU serial number word 1 (LB)
The UPS or system controller’s serial number word 1 (LB).
MCU serial number word 2
The UPS or system controller’s serial number word 2.
MCU serial number word 3
The UPS or system controller’s serial number word 3.
MCU serial number word 4 (HB)
The UPS or system controller’s serial number word 4 (HB).
NMC Alarm - Alarm register 1
Communication lost with MCU
The communication between the NMC and the UPS or system controller is lost.
Lost the management interface-to-UPS communication while the UPS was on battery
The communication management interface-to-UPS between the NMC and the UPS or system controller is lost.
Unknown system type
Unknown system type is detected.
Firmware incompatibility detected
The Reality NMC application firmware is incompatible with the system controller (MCU) firmware.
NMC Alarm - Alarm register 2
Low temperature threshold violation at remote sensor
The measured temperature is below the configured low temperature setting. Only available if (AP9335TH) or (AP9335T) is connected to the NMC.
Minimum temperature threshold violation at remote sensor
The measured temperature is below the configured minimum temperature setting. Only available if (AP9335TH) or (AP9335T) is connected to the NMC.
High temperature threshold violation at remote sensor
The measured temperature is above the configured high temperature setting. Only available if (AP9335TH) or (AP9335T) is connected to the NMC.
Maximum temperature threshold violation at remote sensor
The measured temperature is above the configured maximum temperature setting. Only available if (AP9335TH) or (AP9335T) is connected to the NMC.
Low humidity threshold violation at remote
The measured humidity is below the configured low humidity setting. Only available if (AP9335TH) is connected to the NMC.
Minimum humidity threshold violation at remote sensor
The measured humidity is below the configured minimum humidity setting. Only available if (AP9335TH) is connected to the NMC.
High humidity threshold violation at remote sensor
The measured humidity is above the configured high humidity setting. Only available if (AP9335TH) is connected to the NMC.
Maximum humidity threshold violation at remote sensor
The measured humidity is above the configured maximum humidity setting. Only available if (AP9335TH) is connected to the NMC.
Lost communication to NMC integrated environmental sensor
The communication to the temperature and humidity or the temperature sensor connected to the NMC card is interrupted. Only available if (AP9335TH) or (AP9335T) is connected to the NMC.
System main alarm - Alarm register 1
Common alarm
One or more alarms that are configured for the common alarm are present. The common alarm is mainly intended to be used for external signals.
Urgent event
One or more urgent alarms that require immediate actions are present.
Non urgent alarm
One or more non urgent alarms that require actions are present.
HMI to MCU communication fault
The communication between the display and the controller is interrupted or lost.
ADBUS communication is lost
The communication with one or more optional ADBUS cards are interrupted or lost.
Battery symmetry error
The battery symmetry is out of tolerance.
Battery current-limiting is active
The battery charging current has reached its maximum limit. The rectifier will regulate the DC output current to not overcharge the batteries with a too high charging current.
High DC warning alarm
The system output voltage is above the set high warning voltage level.
High DC shutdown alarm
The system output voltage is above the set high shutdown voltage level.
Low DC warning alarm
The system output voltage is below the set low warning voltage level.
Low DC shutdown alarm
The system output voltage is below the set low shutdown voltage level.
Number of rectifier modules is below warning limit

Only for redundant N+x and N+N module configurations. The number of redundant rectifier modules is currently below the warning limit because of some inoperable rectifier modules. (Calculated based on number of modules).
Number of rectifier modules is below critical limit

Only for redundant N+x and N+N module configurations. The number of redundant rectifier modules are currently below the critical limit because of some inoperable rectifier modules. (Calculated based on number of modules).
Power module current reserve is lost
Only for redundant N+x and N+N module configurations. The output current redundancy is currently not available because of some inoperable rectifier modules. (Calculated based on output current).
One or more modules are inoperable

One or more rectifier modules are inoperable. Depending on the module configuration this might be a warning or a critical alarm. If the system has no redundant rectifier modules, immediate action is required.
One or more modules in over temperature warning
One or more rectifier modules are above the high temperature level.
System main alarm - Alarm register 3
Number of inverter modules is below warning limit
The number of inverter modules is below the warning limit.
Number of inverter modules is below critical limit
The number of inverter modules is below the critical limit.
All inverter modules are inoperable
The inverter output is not available.
No inverter modules are detected by Main controller (MCU)
The MCU (controller) does not detect any inverter modules.
System main alarm - Alarm register 4
SSW module configuration mismatch is detected
The static switch (SSW) module mismatch configuration is detected.
SSW module backfeed contactor is open
The static switch (SSW) module backfeed contactor is open.
SSW module is no longer the primary module for synchronization
The static switch (SSW) module is no longer the primary synchronization module.
SSW module is in CAN bus-off state
The static switch (SSW) module is in CAN bus-off state.
Bypass mains input frequency is out of range
The frequency of the bypass mains input is out of range.
SSW module is not correctly inserted
The static switch (SSW) module is not correctly inserted.
Bypass mains input voltage is out of range
The input voltage of the bypass mains input is out of range.
Output voltage is out of range
The output voltage is out of range.
SSW module CAN communication is lost
The CAN communication with the static switch (SSW) module is lost.
Bypass operation over SSW module is blocked
The static switch (SSW) module's bypass operation is stopped.
System main alarm - Alarm register 5
SSW module have at least one active alarm
At least one alarm is currently active on the static switch (SSW) module.
Main controller (MCU) main alarm - Alarm register 1
MCU hard reset summary warning
The MCU (controller) has detected a hard reset.
MCU system errors summary alarm
The MCU (controller) has detected a system error, for example with the real time clock (RTC), EEPROM, filesystem or task timed out.
MCU memory errors summary alarm
The MCU (controller) is out of memory, for example for the filter or heap.
MCU Modbus errors summary alarm
The MCU (controller) has detected a Modbus server error, for example with Modbus TCP/serial server communication.
MCU initialization is in progress
The MCU (controller) is initializing.
MCU soft reset is active
The MCU (controller) is performing a software reset.
MCU watchdog reset summary alarm
The MCU (controller) has detected a watchdog reset, for example in the MCU (controller), or in one or more modules.
MCU temperature is too high
The MCU (controller) temperature is above the set high temperature level.
System main configuration - Alarm register 1
All power modules are set in SINGLE phase configuration
The rectifier modules are configured for a 1-phase input.
All power modules are set in THREE phase configuration
The rectifier modules are configured for a 3-phase input.
Neutral wire is required
The neutral on the input must be wired. Only for systems with a 1-phase input.
One of the power modules is in DC-DC mode
One of the rectifier/DC–DC modules is configured for DC-DC conversion.
System main operation modes - Alarm register 1
Charger mode is boost-charge
Boost charge mode is active in the rectifier modules. The rectifier DC output voltage is higher than float charge voltage.
Boost charge is blocked
Switch to boost charge mode is blocked. The mode can be blocked by an external/internal signal.
Charger mode is float-charge
Float charge mode is active in the rectifier modules.
Charger mode is direct feed, no batt
The direct feed mode is active in the rectifier modules. Caution, batteries might not be charged anymore.
On battery
Battery operation mode is active (manually or automatically). The batteries are being discharged to supply the load.
Battery equalizing charging
Equalizing charge mode is active in the rectifier modules. The rectifier DC output voltage is higher than float and boost charge voltage.
Battery equalizing charging is blocked
Switch to equalizing charge mode is blocked. The mode can be blocked by an external/internal signal.
System mains operation modes - Alarm register 3
One or more inverter modules are ready for operation
One or more inverter modules are ready for operation.
SSW module is ready for operation
The static switch (SSW) is ready for operation.
MBS is in bypass mains position
The manual bypass switch (MBS) is in bypass mains position.
MBS is in inverter position
The manual bypass switch (MBS) is in inverter position.
SSW module is in inverter mode
The static switch (SSW) module is in the inverter mode.
SSW module is in bypass mains mode
The static switch (SSW) module is in the mains bypass mode.
SSW module is configured to bypass mains priority
The static switch (SSW) module is configured to bypass mains priority.
System breaker status - Alarm register 1
Rectifier AC mains breaker 1
The rectifier AC mains input breaker is open.
Battery breaker 1
The internal battery breaker and/or the external battery breaker is open.
Rectifier DC output breaker
The rectifier DC output breaker is open.
PSU redundancy lost
Power supply unit (PSU) redundancy lost signal is inactive.
DC distribution feeder
One or more distribution output feeders has tripped.
Surge protection device
The AC input surge arrester has tripped.
Option input 1
Digital input option 1 signal is inactive.
Emergency power OFF
The emergency power off (EPO) signal is active.
Inverter DC input breaker
The inverter DC input breaker is open.
Bypass AC mains breaker
The bypass AC mains input breaker is open.
System AC output breaker
The system AC output breaker is open.
AC distribution feeder
The AC distribution feeder is open.
Rectifier AC mains breaker 2
The dual rectifier AC mains input breaker is open.
Battery breaker 2
The internal battery breaker and/or the external battery breaker is open.
Roof fan disturbance
One or more fans have the speed reduce, signal missing or is inoperable.
Battery status/alarm - Alarm register 1
Battery test running
The system is running a battery capacity probe.
A weak battery exists
The result of a battery capacity probe shows that the battery capacity is too low.
Battery test aborted
A battery capacity probe was interrupted.
Battery test configuration error
The battery capacity probe is not configured correctly.
Battery circuit test failed
The battery circuit test showed that the battery is not available to take over the load if needed.
Battery circuit test configuration error
The battery circuit test is not configured correctly.
Battery temperature measurement invalid
The battery temperature sensor is returning an invalid value (NaN or <-90°C). The sensor might not be configured correctly or is not operating correctly.
Battery current-limiting configuration error
The battery current limiting is not configured correctly.
Charger detailed alarm - Alarm register 1
Module configuration mismatch is detected
One or more rectifier modules mismatch configuration are detected.
All rectifier modules switched off
All rectifier modules are switched off from the display or through an external signal.
Some rectifier modules switched off
Some rectifier modules are switched off from the display or through an external signal.
Some rectifier modules in current limitation
One or more rectifier modules have reached current limitation (modules are overloaded).
Some rectifier modules shutdown for overvoltage
One or more rectifier modules have switched OFF because of too high output voltage. (The red LED will flash fast 3 times.)
Rectifier output voltage out of range
The rectifier modules output voltage is above or below the tolerance level.
Mains input in fault condition
The rectifier mains input is not available. The rectifier modules cannot operate.
One or more modules with input voltage out of range
The rectifier mains input is out of tolerance for one or more rectifier modules. Depending on the cause the rectifier modules might not run.
One or more modules have an inoperable fan
At least one of the fans is rotating too slowly or is inoperable.
One or more modules in overtemperature shutdown
One or more rectifier modules are above the temperature shutdown level. The rectifier modules will run with reduced output power.
One or more modules with defective temperature sensor
One or more rectifier modules have a temperature sensor that is inoperable.
Charger detailed alarm - Alarm register 2
Load sharing error in all power modules
The active load sharing between all the rectifier modules is not functioning correctly.
Fan warning in all power modules
The fans in all rectifier modules are rotating too slowly.
Fan fault in all power modules
The fans in all rectifier modules are inoperable.
Input voltage out of range in all power modules
Input voltage out of range in all rectifier modules.
Output voltage out of range in all power modules
The rectifier mains input is out of tolerance for all rectifier modules.
Power module bus error
There is a communication bus error between all rectifier modules and the controller (MCU).
Charger filter logic alarm - Alarm register 1
Logic Gate - Option 1 alarm

ph.ph: Customized (programmable) alarm on request, see system settings or drawings if used.

entry.ph: Logic Gate - Option 2 alarm
Logic Gate - Option 3 alarm
Charger filter delay alarm - Alarm register 1
Delay Gate - Option 1 alarm
Charger filter set-reset gate alarm - Alarm register 1
Filter Set-Reset Gate option 1 alarm
Filter Set-Reset Gate option 2 alarm
Filter Set-Reset Gate option 3 alarm
Earth fault monitoring module alarm (IMDC) - Alarm register 1
IMD 1 - Earth fault positive resistance warning
Insulation resistance from the positive pole below the warning level detected by the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-IMD. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-IMD.
IMD 1 - Earth fault negative resistance warning
Insulation resistance from the negative pole below the warning level detected by the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-IMD. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-IMD.
IMD 1 - Earth fault positive resistance alarm
Insulation resistance from the positive pole below the alarm level detected by the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-IMD. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-IMD.
IMD 1 - Earth fault negative resistance alarm
Insulation resistance from the negative pole below the alarm level detected by the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-IMD. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-IMD.
Batter supervision module alarm (BM60) - Alarm register 1
BM60 1 - Battery measurement out of range on channel 1
The measurement on channel 1 from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM60 is out of tolerance of the specified range. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60.
BM60 1 - Battery measurement out of range on channel 2
The measurement on channel 2 from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM60 is out of tolerance of the specified range. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60.
BM60 1 - Battery measurement out of range on channel 3
The measurement on channel 3 from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM60 is out of tolerance of the specified range. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60.
BM60 1 - Battery measurement out of range on channel 4
The measurement on channel 4 from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM60 is out of tolerance of the specified range. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60.
BM60 1 - Battery supervision module type mismatch
The optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM60 card settings is not matching the battery configuration. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60.
Battery supervision module alarm (BM300) - Alarm register 1
BM300 1 - Battery measurement out of range on channel 1
The measurement on channel 1 from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM300 is out of tolerance of the specified range. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM300.
BM300 1 - Battery measurement out of range on channel 2
The measurement on channel 2 from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM300 is out of tolerance of the specified range. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM300.
BM300 1 - Wrong battery monitoring card detected
The optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM300 card settings is not matching the battery configuration. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM300.
Inverter detailed alarm - Alarm register 1
One or more INV modules configuration mismatch are detected
One or more inverter modules mismatch configuration are detected.
One or more INV modules are switched off by an error
One or more inverter modules are switched off by an error.
One or more INV modules are not correctly inserted
One or more inverter modules are not correctly inserted in the module rack.
One or more INV modules have at least one active alarm
One or more inverter modules have at least one alarm that is in active state.
One or more INV modules output relays are not opening as expected
One or more inverter modules output relays are not opening as expected.
One or more INV modules are no longer the primary module for synchronization
One or more inverter modules are no longer the primary module for synchronization.
One or more INV modules have DC input voltage out of range
The DC input voltage is out of range for one or more inverter modules.
One or more INV modules have AC output voltage out of range
The AC input voltage is out of range for one or more inverter modules.
One or more INV modules ambient temperature is too high
One or more inverter modules ambient temperature is too high.
One or more INV modules is overloaded
One or more inverter modules have reach the current limitation (modules are overloaded).
One or more INV modules are in CAN bus-off state
One or more inverter modules are in CAN bus-off state.
One or more INV modules CAN communication to MCU is lost
One or more inverter modules CAN communication to MCU is lost.
Rectifier module nominal voltage (output)
The nominal voltage of the rectifier modules in the system. [V]
Rectifier module nominal current (output)
The nominal current of the rectifier modules in the system. [A]
Number of power modules
The number of rectifier modules connected and installed in the system.
Modules with available output power
The number of rectifier modules with an output power available.
Number of modules in standby
The number of rectifier modules currently in standby.
Number of rectifier input phases.
The number of mains phases at the rectifier input (1 or 3).
DC Rectifier output voltage
The DC output voltage of the rectifier modules in the system. [V]
DC Rectifier output current
The total DC output current of the rectifier modules in the system. [A]
Load current
The DC current used by the load. [A]
Output power
The total output power of the system. [kW]
Charger output load (% kVA)
The relative output power of the system. [%]
Maximum rectifier ambient temperature
Maximum rectifier ambient temperature [°C]
ACM 1 - AC Voltage L1-N
The measured AC voltage on L1-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-ACM to rectifier system 1. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-ACM. [V]
ACM 1 - AC Voltage L2-N
The measured AC voltage on L2-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-ACM to rectifier system 1. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-ACM. [V]
ACM 1 - AC Voltage L3-N
The measured AC voltage on L3-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-ACM to rectifier system 1. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-ACM. [V]
Relative output power low-pass filtered
The relative output power low-pass is filtered.
Battery voltage 1
The total measured battery voltage of string 1. [V]
Battery current 1
The total measured battery current of string 1. [C]
Nominal battery capacity 1
The available nominal battery capacity of string 1. [Ah]
Final discharge voltage battery 1
The battery discharge voltage of string 1. [V]
Battery capacity withdrawn 1
The amount of used battery capacity of string 1. [Ah]
Battery temperature
The measured battery temperature by the system’s battery temperature sensor. The temperature unit depends on the NMC setting. Temperatures below zero reads as 0. [°C or °F]
Battery test duration
The duration of the latest battery capacity probe. [s]
Last battery test (time stamp)
The time stamp of the last battery capacity probe.
Last battery circuit test (time stamp)
The time stamp of the last battery capacity probe.
Last battery replacement
The time stamp of the last battery replacement.
Input power
The system input power. [kW]
Mains frequency (Max of first 30 modules)
The calculated maximum mains frequency of the first 30 rectifier modules. [Hz]
Mains frequency (Min of first 30 modules)
The calculated minimum mains frequency of the first 30 rectifier modules. [Hz]
Module incoming air temperature (Max of first 30 modules)
The calculated maximum incoming air temperature of the first 30 rectifier modules. [°C]
Module outgoing air temperature (Max of first 30 modules)
The calculated maximum outgoing air temperature. [°C]
Module temperature heat sink (Max of first 30 modules)
The calculated maximum heat sink temperature of the first 30 rectifier modules. [°C]
Module transformer temperature (Max of first 30 modules)
The calculated maximum transformer temperature of the first 30 rectifier modules. [°C]
Battery capacity

The calculated relative available battery capacity (of nominal battery capacity). This value will only show a useful value if the battery capacity test is started with the batteries fully charged. [%]
Charger algebra filter – Option 1
DCM 1 - Temperature
The measured value of the temperature. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-DCM. [°C]
DCM 1 - Volatge
The measured value of the voltage. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-DCM. [V]
DCM 1 - Current 1
The measured value of the current. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-DCM. [A]
DCM 1 - Current 2
The measured value of the current. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-DCM. [A]
IMD 1 - DC Voltage — ground fault monitoring
The measured value of the monitored ground earth fault. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-DCM. [V]
IMD 1 - Earth resistance positive pole R+
The measured value of the monitored earth resistance on the positive (+) pole. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-DCM. [kOhm]
IMD 1 - Earth resistance negative pole R-
The measured value of the monitored earth resistance on the negative (-) pole. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-DCM. [kOhm]
BM60 1 - Measurement input L1–N
The measured value on L1-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. [V]
BM60 1 - Measurement input L2–N
The measured value on L2-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. [V]
BM60 1 - Measurement input L3–N
The measured value on L3-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. [V]
BM60 1 - Measurement input L4–N
The measured value on L4-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. [V]
BM60 1 - Measurement input L5–N
The measured value on L5-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. [V]
BM300 1 – Measurement input L1–N
The measured value on L1-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM300. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. [V]
BM300 1 – Measurement input L2–N
The measured value on L2-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM300. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. [V]
BM300 1 - Measurement input L3–N
The measured value on L3-N from the optionally connected GUMD-ADB-BM300. Requires a connected GUMD-ADB-BM60. [V]
Inverter system maximum active output power (kW)
The measured value of inverter maximum active output power. [kW]
Inverter system relative active output power (% of kW)
The measured value of inverter relative active output power. [%]
Inverter input voltage
The measured value of inverter input voltage. [V]
Inverter module nominal input voltage
The measured value of inverter module nominal input voltage. [V]
Number of inverter power modules
The number of inverter power modules.
Inverter total output current
The measured value of inverter total output current. [A]
Inverter algebra filter - Option 1
Customized selected option.
Inverter algebra filter - Option 2
Customized selected option.
Inverter algebra filter - Option 3
Customized selected option.
Inverter algebra filter - Option 4
Customized selected option.
Bypass mains input voltage (option)
The measured value of bypass mains input voltage. [V]
SSW bypass input voltage
The measured value of static switch (SSW) bypass input voltage. [V]
Inverter output voltage
The measured value of inverter output voltage. [V]
Output voltage
The measured value of output voltage. [V]
Output current
The measured value of output current. [A]
Output frequency
The measured value of output frequency. [Hz]
Output power active
The measured value of output active power. [kW]
Output power apparent
The measured value of output apparent power. [kVA]
Output power reactive
The measured value of output reactive power. [kVA]
Relative active output power (% of kW)
The measured value of relative active output power. [%]
Relative apparent output power (% of kVA)
The measured value of relative apparent output power. [%]
